item.title: Nothing Phone (3) review
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Carl Pei led electronics manufacturer OnePlus from being a scrappy brand for tech enthusiasts offering affordable phones to one that produces multiple lines of devices, including flagship phones that challenge Samsung and Apple. He is running a similar playbook with Nothing, a five-year-old, venture-backed hardware startup that just launched its most ambitious device, the Phone […]

item.title: Why this LA-based VC firm was an early investor in Slate Auto
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: Slate Auto, which came out of stealth mode earlier this year with a surprising – and surprisingly affordable – customizable electric truck, has raised $700 million to date. But long before the EV startup broke cover, it quietly raised a Series A round of more than $100 million in 2023. And while Jeff Bezos was […]

item.title: Frontier is helping Arbor build a “vegetarian rocket engine” to power data centers
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Arbor Energy's carbon-removing power plant is inspired by SpaceX's rocket engines.

item.title: UAE proptech Huspy raises $59M to scale in Europe
item.dc:creator: Tage Kene-Okafor
item.description: If you walked into a Dubai bank to apply for a mortgage in 2020, chances are you’d spend months buried in paperwork or face a huge price discrepancy when it came to listings. Such experiences led Jad Antoun to start Huspy, a startup streamlining how people in the UAE buy homes digitally. Over the past […]

item.title: OpenAI tightens the screws on security to keep away prying eyes
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: OpenAI has reportedly overhauled its security operations to protect against corporate espionage. According to the Financial Times, the company accelerated an existing security clampdown after Chinese startup DeepSeek released a competing model in January, with OpenAI alleging that DeepSeek improperly copied its models using “distillation” techniques. The beefed-up security includes “information tenting” policies that limit […]

item.title: Meta reportedly recruits Apple’s head of AI models
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: Ruoming Pang previously ran Apple's in-house team that trained the AI foundation models that underpin Apple Intelligence and other on-device AI features.

item.title: Tulum Energy rediscovered a forgotten hydrogen tech and used it to raise $27M
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Results of a 20-year-old curiosity now form the basis of Tulum, a startup that has attracted significant investor attention.

item.title: Cursor apologizes for unclear pricing changes that upset users
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: Cursor's CEO issued an apology this weekend over an unclear change to its pricing model that resulted in some users being charged more.

item.title: Fortnite maker Epic Games settles antitrust case against Samsung
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Epic had alleged in the lawsuit that Samsung's "Auto Blocker" feature, which blocked downloads outside of the Google Play Store and Samsung Galaxy Store, was a coordinated effort to block competition in app distribution.

item.title: ChatGPT is testing a mysterious new feature called ‘study together’
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: The mode is apparently the chatbot's way of becoming a better educational tool. Rather than providing answers to prompts, some say it asks more questions and requires the human to answer.

item.title: Bluesky users can customize their notifications, including activity alerts from their favorite accounts
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Bluesky updated its notifications to allow users to personalize their experience, including the option to be notified only when accounts reply to them.

item.title: iOS 26 beta 3 dials back Liquid Glass
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: The early version in the first developer beta of iOS 26 and the accompanying updates for Apple's other devices still left room for improvement in terms of usability, accessibility, and legibility.

item.title: Jack Dorsey working on Bluetooth messaging app, Bitchat
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Block CEO and Twitter co-founder Jack Dorsey wrote in an X post on Sunday night that he spent his weekend creating an app called Bitchat (presumably a combination of the words “bit” and “chat,” and not the other combination of words that it looks like). Bitchat is a messaging app that operates through Bluetooth mesh […]

item.title: Tennis players criticize AI technology used by Wimbledon
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Some tennis players are not happy with Wimbledon’s new AI line judges, as reported by The Telegraph. This is the first year the prestigious tennis tournament, which is still ongoing, replaced human line judges, who determine if a ball is in or out, with an electronic line calling system (ELC). Numerous players criticized the AI […]

item.title: CoreWeave acquires data center provider Core Scientific in $9B stock deal
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: As a result of the deal, CoreWeave says it will gain access to more than a gigawatt of data center capacity — enough energy to power more than 850,000 homes.

item.title: Waymo robotaxis are heading to Philadelphia and NYC
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Waymo kicked off two “road trips” to Philadelphia and New York City on Monday, signaling the Alphabet-owned company’s push to expand into cities in the Northeast.

item.title: Threads is nearing X’s daily app users, new data shows
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Threads' mobile app for iOS and Android saw 115.1 million daily active users, representing 127.8% year-over-year growth.

item.title: AI is forcing the data industry to consolidate — but that’s not the whole story
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: While AI may be the catalyst behind the recent wave of data company M&A, the market was ripe for consolidation.

item.title: TikTok reportedly developing new version of app ahead of planned US sale
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: TikTok is developing a new version of its app for U.S. users ahead of an expected sale of the app to a group of investors, according to a new report from The Information.

item.title: Ingram Micro says ongoing outage caused by ransomware attack
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: The outage is reportedly affecting software licensing, preventing Ingram Micro's customers from using or provisioning some products that rely on Ingram's systems.
